anime.description: The Vega homeworld is becoming unstable due to the exploiting of Vegatron, a powerful radioactive ore. Seeking to expand his militaristic empire and find a substitute planet to settle upon, the ruthless King Vega unleashes his armies - composed of flying saucers and giant robotic monsters - and turns first against neighbours such as Fleed, a highly advanced but peaceful world. In a tragically ironic twist, the invaders` blitzkrieg turns against them: the once verdant, idyllic Fleed is turned into a radioactive wasteland. Too late, the only known survivor of the royal family, Prince Duke Fleed, manages to steal the Grendizer, the robotic embodiment of the Fleedian God of War, from the Vegan invaders who plan to use it to spearhead their invasion fleet. Fleeing Vegan space by flying at faster than light speed, Duke enters the Solar system and switches course to Earth, making a rough landing in Japan, on the slopes of Mount Fuji ... Source: Wikipedia Note: Episode 49 was also shown at the Toei Manga Festival event on 19.12.1976 under the changed title Akai Yuuhi no Taiketsu (赤い夕陽の対決).

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: alien
tag.description: This entity or creature was born on another world than the main characters.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: Moon
tag.description: The Moon is an astronomical body that orbits planet Earth, being Earth`s only permanent natural satellite. It is the fifth-largest natural satellite in the Solar System, and the largest among planetary satellites relative to the size of the planet that it orbits. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: other planet
tag.description: The anime will fit this category if some or all of the action takes place on another planet which is supposedly in the same universe as Earth, not a complete fantasy world; usually there has to be some concept of space travel. The Latin name for Earth - Terra, would also pass the condition of being in the same universe as Earth. Basically, even mentioning of Earth existing or having existed would be enough. Although Moon is a moon, it also qualifies as Other Planet.

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: space colony
tag.description: The human race (or possibly some alien race) has mastered space travel and founded at least one colony either in space, on a moon or another planet. This usually also includes colony-life episodes that not only show the technical staff of professionals (astronauts, scientists, etc.), but also their families (i.e. children).

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: super robot
tag.description: These robots tend to have almost semi-magical attacks, which seem impossible or non-realistic, and/or perform non-realistic transformation sequences where they seem to gain/lose mass and utterly change their form, even if it means making their super-hard armour bend like plastic sheets.

tag.name: daikaijuu
tag.description: Literally translating to giant monster, daikaiju is an element found often in Japanese entertainment. Although usually for the science fiction genre it is also often used in horror, fantasy, mecha, and to a lesser extent comedy. Any monster that towers over a house technically qualifies as a daikaiju. Some anime, usually mecha, will go as far as calling their daikaiju with a specific title.

tag.name: sense of foreboding
tag.description: The anime starts off quietly, everything seems to be fine, but from episode to episode the signs that something ominous is about to happen increase. E.g. a typical mystery setting.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Super Robot Wars
tag.description: Super Robot Wars is a series of tactical role-playing video games produced by Banpresto. The main feature of the franchise is having a story that crosses over several popular mecha anime, manga and video games, allowing characters and mecha from different titles to team up or battle one another. Due to the nature of crossover games and licensing involved, only a few games have been released outside Japan, and in English; early English-language games only feature Banpresto`s original characters and mecha, and a flagship installment were to never be released until 2016, with the English release of Super Robot Wars V in Southeast Asian countries. The franchise celebrated its 25th anniversary in 2016. Source: Wikipedia

Ah! My Land That Was So Green
Le prince d`un autre monde
Aa!! Waga daichi midorinariki
episode.summary: Kouji discovers the identity of Duke Fleed, but has no time to ask questions because Vega attacks. Duke Fleed and Kouji unite their power and push back the enemy. Source: tv.com

Danger at the White Birch Ranch
La fiesta tragique
L`incubo - Pericolo alla fattoria

The Spirit of Youth Is Burning
L`île de la peur

episode.title: 炎の愛を夕陽に染めて
Love in the Evening of Glory
Le traquenard de la mort
episode.summary: Kouji, Hikaru, Goro and Banta are taken hostage. Duke Fleed interrupts his siesta to free them. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 大空を斬る闘魂
The Fighting Spirit Heads Towards Space
Attaque sur Perlepolis
episode.summary: Hikaru leaves for Tokyo with Banta. Their bus is attacked by a Saucer Beast. Kouji distracts the monster until Duke Fleed arrives since Grendizer has trouble to start up in winter. Source: tv.com

episode.title: たとえ我が命つきるとも
Even If I Lose My Life
Le festin des loups
episode.summary: Gorman, from the fearsome Ruins` Division, attacks Grendizer that is powerless in front of the brutality and the agility of his enemy. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 地球の緑はあたたかい
The Greenery of Earth Is Warm
Les radars se sont tus
episode.summary: Blacky sets a trap to Grendizer by hiding mines in a cloud of spatial dust. Kouji falls in the trap. Fortunately Duke Fleed helps him and destroys the Golgoth 8. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 許されざる怒りを越えて
Overcome the Forbidden Anger
Le camp de la lune noire
episode.summary: Kouji is captured with his UFO by the Vegans. Grendizer attacks the camp of the Black Moon to save him. Source: tv.com

episode.title: あこがれは星の彼方に
Adoration Towards the Stars
L`espion qui venait de Véga
episode.summary: An inhabitant of the planet Ruby is contacted by Vega to explode the UFO carrier of Grendizer. The mission fails because of Duke Fleed and the Vegans try to kill the Rubinian. But Duke Fleed flies to his help. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 黒い太陽の中の悪魔
The Evil Ones in the Black Sun
Le jour où le soleil s`arrêta
episode.summary: The Vegans plan is to bring Grendizer to the shadow of the moon during the eclipse because Grendizer`s systems will shut down temporarily under it and then destroy it. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 虹の橋を渡る少女
A Girl Crosses the Rainbow Bridge
Du sang sur la neige
episode.summary: Daisuke and Kouji are sent to investigate an avalanche and to find survivors. They find a girl named Miyuki who lost her memory. Back at the Space Science Lab she begins to remember how a saucer destroyed her home. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 狙われたグレンダイザー
Grendizer Is in Danger
Par le fer et par le feu
episode.summary: A new Vegan mecha comes to destroy Earth. It sucks power from the sun and burns everything in its path. Grendizer is damaged by it and has to withdraw. As the mecha attacks again Grendizer has to go to battle weaponless. Source: tv.com

episode.title: ボスボロットがやって来た!!
Boss Borot Is Here!!
Le jour du soleil levant
episode.summary: Boss, Nuke, and Mocha are in this episode. They are visiting their old friend Kouji Kabuto. The Vegans keep their eyes on a mysterious orange robot that is found skiing nearby. Commander Blacky orders the Minifo to follow and investigate it. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 遥かなる母への手紙
To My Dear Mother
Akerebe la Rouge
episode.summary: Commander Yara is forced to create a mecha that creates earthquakes and use it on the city Kanto. Source: tv.com

episode.title: こころにひびく愛の鐘
The Bell of Love That Resounds in the Heart
Le fiancé de la mort
episode.summary: A Vegan pilot lands near the Space Science Centre and makes Mr. Hayashi`s fiance, Kaori, a spy for him. She takes Dr. Umon as a hostage. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 小さな生命を救え!
Saving a Small Life!
La chevauchée infernale
episode.summary: The Vegans begin building a base for their operations on Earth. The saucer "Giba Giba" begins to attack but Grendizer comes to save the day by saving a town and a mountain. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 発進!! 秘密ルート7
The Launching of the Secret Route Number 7
Le nouveau temps des cavernes
episode.summary: Dr. Umon made a project so that Grendizer is able to launch without revealing his whereabouts to the enemy. Kabuto is in the control of the Vegans and fights Duke. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 恐怖のエアロライト!
The Aerolight of Fear!
Le village écrasé
episode.summary: The Vegans are causing a shower of asteroids heading towards Earth. The meteors are detected and Grendizer launches to intercept them before they hit land. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 決死の雪山脱出作戦
The Escape from the Snow-Covered Mountain
Terre en danger
episode.summary: Daisuke gets the suspicion that the Vegans may be planning to pull the moon down to Earth. Duke Fleed launches Grendizer and follows Kouji who already went to explore the area of Mount Kirofoki. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 決戦! オーロラの輝き
Decisive Battle! Aurora`s Glow
Les continents submergés
episode.summary: The Vegans plan to melt ice in the North Pole. This will cause the sea level to rise with catastrophic results to the shores on Earth. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 花一輪の勇気
The Courage of a Flower
Les massacreurs du ciel
episode.summary: The Vegans are planning to steal Dr. Chibana`s new device so that they can use it to silence Duke Fleed and his Grendizer. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 激流に叫ぶひかる
Hikaru Calls for Help Across the Rapids
Le déluge des nouveaux mondes
episode.summary: The Vegans continue their attempts to discover Grendizer`s secret hideout as they are sure that the Space Science Centre has something to do with it. Hikaru finds out who Daisuke really is. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 危うしデュークフリード!
Duke Fleed Is in Danger!
L`exécuteur
episode.summary: Commander Whiter successfully sneaks into Earth as Dr. Space who is a well-known acquaintance of Dr. Umon and a reliable person so he can find Duke Fleed and kill him. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 大空に輝く愛の花
A Flower of Love Bloomed in the Sky
Les amoureux d`Euphor
episode.summary: Duke Fleed`s childhood friends Naida, brainwashed by the Vegans, attempts to put a bomb on Grendizer but Duke stops her. Naida accuses Duke of being a traitor. Kouji attempts to pilot Grendizer but is almost killed. Source: tv.com

episode.title: スカルムーン総出撃!
Skull Moon Base Successive Attacks!
Les bords de l`abîme
episode.summary: Dr. Umon sends Kouji and Hayashi on a mission in outer space to build a satellite station. At the same time, the Space Science Centre is surrounded by a huge Minifo saucer squadron. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 猛攻撃! グレンダイザー
Onslaught! Grendizer
Vaincre ou périr
episode.summary: Grendizer`s delicate weapon systems malfunction and he finds himself struggling against the enemy. The Vegans arrive and descend upon the Center. Hikaru and Daisuke must fix Grendizer and save the Center. Source: tv.com

episode.title: さらば宇宙の友よ!
Farewell, My Friend of the Universe!
L`oiseau de feu
episode.summary: Vegans shrink the cells of the living body to make Haruk become a young boy for a time so he can spy at Space Science Centre. Haruk and Goro become friends but later the effects of the shrinking begin to wear off so Haruk captures Goro. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 闇夜に響く悪魔のベル
The Bell of the Devil in the Dark
Les nouveaux maîtres des ténèbres
episode.summary: General Zuril is a brilliant scientist who will try to find different ways of taking down Grendizer. Daisuke, Hikaru, and Goro are attacked by Vegans. Danbei puts on his gear and begins fighting them too. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 赤い傷跡のバラード
Ballad of the Red Scar
La pierre de foudre
episode.summary: A strange rock full of radiation energy lands on Earth and Dr. Umon can`t make much of this new phenomenon. At the same time, the Vegans discover this strong source of energy and put it to use in their next saucer beast. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 飛べ! ダブルスペイザー
Fly! Double Spazer
Le premier raid
episode.summary: General Gandal assigns Commander Beetle with his saucer beast to attack the Space Science Centre from underground. Meanwhile, Kabuto Kouji`s new Double Spazer ship has just been completed and Kouji is ready to be air-born again. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 地の底に悪魔がいた!
Devils from the Depth of the Earth!
Un monde en fusion
episode.summary: Duke Fleed unites with Kouji and the Drill Spazer to chase a Vegan saucer beast. The Vegans make an acid swamp to sink the Space Science Center. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 燃える大空の誓い!
An Oath in Space
L`invincible du cosmos
episode.summary: Dr. Umon calls Daisuke and Kouji to show them the way that Grendizer and Double Spazer can unite together and fly. The objective of this is to minimize the need for Grendizer to have to lock in and out of Spazer as these are Grendizer`s weakest moments and he is helpless in them. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 戦慄! 白鳥が来た日
The Day the Swans Came!
Les cygnes
episode.summary: Swans are implanted with Vegatron missiles for the next Vegan plan. Duke Fleed is forced to kill the swans and must head to the city and face saucer beast "Go Go". Source: tv.com

episode.title: 襲撃! 恐怖の怪気球
The Frightening Air Balloon!
Le monstre du Loch Ness
episode.summary: Vegans gather some fuel from an industrial island. General Zuril instructs General Gandal on what to do but he doesn`t listen and he gets into trouble because his unilateral action revealed that the Vegans have a base on Earth. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 危機! 研究所よ立ちあがれ
An Emergency Situation in the Space Science Center!
Péril en la demeure
episode.summary: Dr. Umon`s Space Science Center is undergoing some major changes to keep up with Vega`s attacks. A super computer is installed in the base, and turning it on will be the final step. The Vegans plan to get rid of the base and leave Grendizer without a place to hide. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 兜甲児一本勝負!
Kabuto Kouji in a One-Game Match!
Un grand entre les grands
episode.summary: The Vegans fire a big group of missiles towards Tokyo. The Grendizer Team launches to destroy the missiles before they hit the city. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 死の海底400m!
Death at 400 Meters Below Sea Level!
La mort vient de la mer
episode.summary: Maria in the Marine Spazer gets stuck in a giant seaweed trap and Kouji swims to the bottom of the sea to help her. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 決死の海底基地爆破
Destroy the Marine Base
Opération plongée
episode.summary: General Zuril launches an attack on the Space Science Center with air balloon bombs. Kouji gets caught by the Vegans and is held as a hostage. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 母に向って撃て!
Rebellion Against the Mother!
La reine fantôme
episode.summary: The Vegans send a woman by the name of Marian who looks identical to Duke Fleed`s mother who passed away on planet Fleed. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 死闘! キングゴリを倒せ
Mortal Combat with King Gori!!
La bête
episode.summary: Grendizer is damaged and Hikaru got captivated. Duke Fleed follows Hikaru on foot and helps her to escape from the giant beast while Kouji takes Grendizer back for repairs. written by: nadeschda

episode.title: この美しい地球のために
For This Beautiful Earth
Pour l`amour de la terre
Due amici inseparabili - Scontro finale
episode.summary: King Vega prepares to attack Earth but Duke and company are ready to stop him with the help of Grendizer and the Spazers. Source: tv.com

episode.title: ひかる, 涙のドッキング!
A Tearful Connection with Hikaru!
Les faiseurs de ténèbres
episode.summary: Hikaru becomes a pilot. Duke Fleed faces another Vegan saucer beast loaded with Vegatron rays, and Kouji nearly gets captured by the Minifo after gathering the energy but manages to escape very injured. Source: tv.com

episode.title: ベガ大王軍団大移動!
The Exodus of the Army of Vega Daio!
La génération des monstres
episode.summary: General Zuril orders a powerful attack with his latest saucer beast "Domo Domo" to defeat Grendizer before General Dantos gets the chance. Source: tv.com

episode.title: マリンスペイザー出動せよ!
The Launching of the Marine Spazer!
Le baptême du feu
episode.summary: Hikaru loses her consciousness during training and Duke Fleed gets injured and his old wound gets worse. The Vegans begin their attack and Daisuke goes to the battle even though he is injured. Source: tv.com

episode.title: 悪魔にされたグレンダイザー!
